news.title: House Passes Bill to Make PACER Free as Judiciary Opposes
news.description: Supporters of the bill assert that technology is essential to preserve access to justice and court records, while detractors point to its budgetary and operational impact on federal courts.

news.title: Federal Courts Participate in Audio Livestream Pilot
news.description: As part of a two-year pilot program, 13 district courts will livestream real-time courtroom audio of select proceedings in civil cases of public interest on their designated YouTube channels.

news.title: Employers Can Require Workers to Get Covid-19 Vaccine, U.S. Says
news.description: Federal disability laws that protect the medical privacy of employees do not prevent employers from barring employees from the workplace if they refuse the COVID-19 vaccine.

news.title: Supreme Court Has Golden Opportunity To Rein In NCAA ‘Amateurism’
news.description: The Supreme Court granted review of a Ninth Circuit decision that addresses whether the college sports industry may enforce amateurism rules that forbid paying college athletes.
